Dear Disney,

I have been a fan of Disney since childhood and I believe in Disney’s power in bringing positivity and change for children and adults worldwide. However, it has come to my concern that Crystal Liu Yifei, the actress for the coming live-action Mulan, may not be the right choice to represent a character as righteous as Mulan.

On 15 August 2019, she reposted a criticism against the Hong Kong protestors on social media. In the past few months, over 2 million Hong Kong citizens have protested against the extradition law that may endanger the locals’ freedoms. However, the Hong Kong government has continued responding to people’s demands with unlawful violence. Police brutality has become commonplace - tear gas and bullets were used thoughtlessly and there have been multiple cases in which the police SEXUALLY HARRASSED the female protestors (i.e. Hong Kong police removing a protestor’s underwear during arrest).

As both a feminist and a fan of Mulan, I am aghasted by Liu’s statement in support of the Hong Kong police, whose actions violate women’s rights and human rights as a whole. Because of her support for the oppressors, I am doubtful about whether she is the right person to represent Mulan - an iconic character whose courage in the face of oppression inspires countless souls worldwide. As her action goes against Disney’s mission to spread hope and positivity, I sincerely hope that Disney will reconsider the casting choice and give the world the Mulan we deserve.

Best regards,
A Hong Kong citizen
